ch.se.inf.ethz.jcd.batman.cli

Interface CommandLine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommandLineInterface

    public interface CommandLine
    Interface for a command line.
    See Also:
    CommandLineInterface, Command

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void attachCommand(Command command)
      Attaches the given command to the CLI.
      void detachCommand(Command command)
      Removes the given command from the CLI.
      VDiskFile getCurrentLocation()
      Returns the current location of the CLI inside the loaded disk.
      void setCurrentLocation(VDiskFile newLoc)
      Sets a new location at which the CLI is currently.
      void start()
      Starts the workflow described at class level.
      void stop()
      Stops the running workflow.
      void write(java.lang.Exception ex)
      Writes the given exception into the console.
      void write(java.lang.String text)
      Writes the given text into the console.
      void write(java.lang.String format, java.lang.Object... args)
      Wrapper around write(String) with a String.format(String, Object...) like interface.
      void writeln(java.lang.String text)
      Same as write(String) except that it adds a newline at the end.
      void writeln(java.lang.String format, java.lang.Object... args)
      Wrapper around writeln(String) with a String.format(String, Object...) like interface.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the workflow described at class level. A call to stop() will stop the workflow.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the running workflow.

      • attachCommand

        void attachCommand(Command command)
        Attaches the given command to the CLI.
        Parameters:
        command - CLI command to attach

      • detachCommand

        void detachCommand(Command command)
        Removes the given command from the CLI.
        Parameters:
        command - CLI command to detach

      • write

        void write(java.lang.String text)
        Writes the given text into the console. The visible text starts with the CLI_OUTPUT_PREFIX followed by the given text.
        Parameters:
        text - text to write into the console

      • write

        void write(java.lang.String format,
         java.lang.Object... args)
        Wrapper around write(String) with a String.format(String, Object...) like interface. It's just a wrapper around String.format(String, Object...), so it can be used the exact same way.
        Parameters:
        format - String.format(String, Object...)
        args - String.format(String, Object...)
        See Also:
        String.format(String, Object...)

      • writeln

        void writeln(java.lang.String text)
        Same as write(String) except that it adds a newline at the end.
        Parameters:
        text - text to write into the console followed by a newline

      • writeln

        void writeln(java.lang.String format,
           java.lang.Object... args)
        Wrapper around writeln(String) with a String.format(String, Object...) like interface. It's just a wrapper around String.format(String, Object...), so it can be used the exact same way.
        Parameters:
        format - String.format(String, Object...)
        args - String.format(String, Object...)

      • write

        void write(java.lang.Exception ex)
        Writes the given exception into the console. This can be used to inform the user about an exception.
        Parameters:
        ex - Exception to show the user in the console

      • getCurrentLocation

        VDiskFile getCurrentLocation()
        Returns the current location of the CLI inside the loaded disk.
        Returns:
        the location at which the CLI currently is or null if no disk is loaded.

      • setCurrentLocation

        void setCurrentLocation(VDiskFile newLoc)
        Sets a new location at which the CLI is currently. A passed null value indicates that no disk is loaded and therefore no location available. CommandLineInterface will not call any methods on the old location / disk. The caller has to make sure to unload everything the right way.
        Parameters:
        newLoc - the new location or null if no disk is loaded.
